duporder.description: An element is in the set, or it's not. When you write out the values for a set, it doesn't matter if you write them more than once, or what order you write them in. It's the same set.
duporder.question: Let $P = \{7, 11, 42\}$. What are some other ways that you can write $P$?

elements.description: Set members are typically drawn from some larger population known as the base type
elements.question: If $P = \{7, 11, 42\}$, what is the base type of it's elements?

members.description: Each member of a set is either a primitive element of the base type or is a set itself.
members.question: Let $P = \{a, b, c, \{d, e\}, \{f\}\}$. Which of the followings are an element in the set?
